intro: Genistella sagittalis subsp. undulata, commonly known as the wavy broom. It is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The species belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, with the central leaflet being longer and more slender than the lateral ones. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
